03 申请规划概述 Overview of Application Planning

这一部分展示了规划导师与你沟通交流以后为你制定的申请意向专业方向、申请国家、申请形象、学术主线、个人特色副线。申请形象指的是你的申请材料希望给招生官展现你是怎样一个人，在一些可量化可直接对比的成绩成就奖项等硬件之外，还能体现你怎样的个性、品质、故事、特点、兴趣和热情，往往这些软性的东西更能让招生官对你印象深刻。学术主线是申请意向专业方向的展开和细化，个人特色副线则是在学术主线之外你的第二主要特点，有可能是另一个有一定联系或一定反差的学术线，也有可能是非学术的例如户外冒险、艺术音乐、某种理念追求、某个方面的社会关怀等等。学术主线和个人特色副线共同塑造一个更为立体、更为多元、更有区分度的申请形象，使你从同专业方向的申请者中脱颖而出。
传播学 社会学／科学 人类学 戏剧

Mimi has developed a keen interest in understanding the experiences of **"Third Culture** **Kids,"** particularly those who are first-g eneration individuals growing up in a country different from that of their parents. She is especially curious about themes such a s finding a sense of belonging, the complexities of relationships with parents, and the responsibilities that come with cultural fid elity.

To explore her interests more deeply, Mimi is considering various academic disciplines, including **anthropology, sociology,** **me** dia studies, and theatre. She finds herself particularly drawn to sociology and theatre, as these fields can offer valuable insights into cultural identity and interpersonal dynamics.

We have gathered several resources to help her explore these disciplines. Her goal is to initiate a passion project focused on her interests this summer, which will guide her toward a more defined academic path. By the end of the summer, she **hopes** to ide **ntify** a **specific** **discipline** that resonates **with** her aspirations and passions.
This exploration not only aims to deepen her understanding of her own cultural experiences but also seeks to connect with oth ers who may share similar journeys.
As a 3rd culture kid, what is my root, and should I have a root?
这一部分记录了你9-12年级完整的在校成绩情况。在校成绩是招生官对你学术能力判断的基础指标，好的在校成绩是申请顶尖大学的基本门槛。另外在校选课应体现与申请意向专业方向相一致或相关联的学术兴趣。
｜ UWC South East Asia Singapore 中学
Make sure you get good grades for every subject, as high as possible. It will be great for you to keep all 7 for each subject.

这一部分记录了你已经取得的各项标化考试成绩以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的的未来标化考试计划。标化考试成绩是在校成绩之外的又一重要学术实力评判标准，顾名思义，它的意义在于更为标准化，不同学校的在校成绩往往很难比较，标化考试成绩弥补了这一点，于是也是很被招生官看重的。另外一些所在高中并不知名的学生可以通过标化考试进一步证明自己的学术能力基本面。
这一部分记录了你已经完成的课外活动、正在进行的课外活动、以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的下一步课外活动计划。课外活动是体现软实力的重要阵地，通过合理的规划，我们希望通过课外活动有重点、有层次、有细节、有亮点、生动全面地体现你的申请形象、学术主线、个人特色副线。（将来在大学网申中你的活动细节无法在有限的活动列表描述字符中体现的部分我们也会考虑通过额外信息部分加以展开和展示。）

这一部分记录了你已经参加的夏校、以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的正在申请中或计划要申请的夏校。参加夏校可以帮助你在专业方向上提前进行大学水平的学习，其中含金量较高的夏校在大学申请时作用有时类似于学术类奖项，能够进一步证明进阶学术实力，并且可以通过夏校争取教授推荐信。另外上过某个大学的夏校也可以证明对该校的入读兴趣，对一些大学来说，这种情况下再选择ED申请该校会有加成。

**| Northwestern University National High School Institute**

NHSI has been the premier university-based summer program for outstanding high school students since 1931. The oldest and largest university-based program of its kind, NHSI offers studies in Theatre Arts, Film & Video, and Debate as

follows: -Theatre Arts Institute Current high school juniors who will be rising into their senior year can choose this 5-week programs between Performance or Stage Management Design/Tech; Students also can choose the 2-week Musical Theatre Extension Program after the 5-week Theatre Arts program. Additionally students can choose 3 electives from a multitude of classes offered by the faculty in specialized areas of study from: Preparing for College Auditions, The Real Life of an Actor, Viewpoints, Self-Producing, Improvisation, Playwriting, Theatre for Social Change, Directing, Shakespeare Without Rears, Stage Combat; -Film and Video Institute For this 5-week program Students can select a concentration from: Acting on Camera, Screenwriting, Production. Applicants should currently be in the 10th grade/sophomore year or 11th grade/junior year. -Debate institute: Students must be rising into 9th, 10th,11th, or 12th grade the summer they are participating. Program takes hybird format (online+on campus course) with the choice of 4 weeks or 6 weeks.

The Boston University Summer Theatre Institute is a five-week pre-college experience which focuses on developing and crafting the skills of a multi-disciplinary theatre artist. Students graduate from BUSTI having honed their technique, depth of intellectual and artistic questioning, playfulness in collaboration, and ability to tell a dynamic story through the theatrical medium.

Pre-College Dramna is a six-week residential program for high school juniors and seniors that offers training and preparation for college auditions and interviews within an acclaimed drama conservatory. Students choose from one of three options below to prepare for an education and career in theater: -Acting: Acting, Audition, Acting for the Camera, Dramaturgy; training in Movement, Shakespeare, and Voice & Speech; -Design/Production: Basic Design, Technical Production, and Stage & Production Management; Introductory work in Lighting, Sounds, Video/Media, Costumes, and Fabrication Technology; -Music theatre: Audition process monologues and songs; Ballet and Jazz classes will provide inexperienced students; MT students will also take classes in Acting, Audition, Acting for the Camera, Song Coaching, and Dramaturgy. Optional workshops and master classes are held in the evenings; Weekends are intended for homework, independent rehearsal, and Student Affairs activities.
| Summer Workshop for Young Writers at Kelly W/riters House

Kelly Writers House will bring a small group of high school writers to Penn' s campus for ten days this summer to learn from the faculty from one another. The goal of this workshop is to provide creative hnigh school students, especially those who have not had similar opportunities, with the chance to dedicate full days to the practice of writing. Students will develop their own work and will read and critique their peers' writing in a setting similar to anundergraduate writing workshop. There will also be time to explore Penn and Philadelphia with fellow workshop students and program staff.
| lowa Young Writers' Studio: Summer Residential Program

Program accepts applications to the Summer Residential Program from students who are currently in the 10th, 11th or 12th grade. (9th graders may apply, though we only rarely accept them). The University of lowa Writers' Workshop was the first creative writing degree program in the United States, and since its founding in 1936, the program has been home to thousands of remarkable writers. The core courses are taught by graduates of the renowned lowa Writers' Workshop. Students may select a core course in fiction writing, poetry writing, TV writing, play writing or creative writing which includes some combination of fiction, poetry, and personal essay).

（原身应该就是CSHI现在变成了卡村综合课程夏校中的一个分支） SLAI-Humanities course is named as Modes of Knowing,Sites of Encounter. Students will complete research in one of four course and will learn to use techniques of research, interpretation, and presentation that are essential to achieve the goals of humanistic research: to understand with depth and complexity the nature of human thought, action, and expression and to convey this understanding to others. 2025 Courses topics as follows: -History and Philosophy: Power, Knowledge, and Uncertainty in the Renaissance; -Literature, Theatre and Art: Seeing
Shakespeare; -Art History: Visualizing Race, Power and Colonialism; -History of Maps and Mapmaking: Maps, Knowledge and

Stanford Summer Humanities Institute offers two two-week online sessions with distinctive courses for. Program seeks intellectually curious students with a deep interest in the humanities. Students will develop their interests in writing, philosophy, literature, art, or history. Admission is selective and the course subject including Greek<s, Revolution History, Ancient Rome, American Enlightenment, Realism. 2025 Course Including: Books to Bollywood(NEW), Revolutions, Ancient Rome and Its Legacies, The American Enlightenment, Racial Identity in the American Imagination, The Creek and Beyond, Colonial Extraction of African Cultural Treasures, Spiritual Ecologies: Religion and the Climate Crisis(NEW)

eneration individuals growing up in a country different from that of their parents. She is especially curious about themes such a
s finding a sense of belonging, the complexities of relationships with parents, and the responsibilities that come with cultural fid
To explore her interests more deeply, Mimi is considering various academic disciplines, including anthropology, sociology, me
dia studies, and theatre. She finds herself particularly drawn to sociology and theatre, as these fields can offer valuable insights

structured.text: 这一部分展示了规划导师与你沟通交流以后为你制定的申请意向专业方向、申请国家、申请形象、学术主线、个人特色副线。申请形象指的是你的申请材料希望给招生官展现你是怎样一个人，在一些可量化可直接对比的成绩成就奖项等硬件之外，还能体现你怎样的个性、品质、故事、特点、兴趣和热情，往往这些软性的东西更能让招生官对你印象深刻。学术主线是申请意向专业方向的展开和细化，个人特色副线则是在学术主线之外你的第二主要特点，有可能是另一个有一定联系或一定反差的学术线，也有可能是非学术的例如户外冒险、艺术音乐、某种理念追求、某个方面的社会关怀等等。学术主线和个人特色副线共同塑造一个更为立体、更为多元、更有区分度的申请形象，使你从同专业方向的申请者中脱颖而出。
传播学 社会学／科学 人类学 戏剧

Mimi has developed a keen interest in understanding the experiences of "Third Culture Kids," particularly those who are first-g eneration individuals growing up in a country different from that of their parents. She is especially curious about themes such a s finding a sense of belonging, the complexities of relationships with parents, and the responsibilities that come with cultural fid elity.

To explore her interests more deeply, Mimi is considering various academic disciplines, including anthropology, sociology, me dia studies, and theatre. She finds herself particularly drawn to sociology and theatre, as these fields can offer valuable insights into cultural identity and interpersonal dynamics.

We have gathered several resources to help her explore these disciplines. Her goal is to initiate a passion project focused on her interests this summer, which will guide her toward a more defined academic path. By the end of the summer, she hopes to ide ntify a specific discipline that resonates with her aspirations and passions.
This exploration not only aims to deepen her understanding of her own cultural experiences but also seeks to connect with oth ers who may share similar journeys.
As a 3rd culture kid, what is my root, and should I have a root?

structured.text: 这一部分记录了你已经参加的夏校、以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的正在申请中或计划要申请的夏校。参加夏校可以帮助你在专业方向上提前进行大学水平的学习，其中含金量较高的夏校在大学申请时作用有时类似于学术类奖项，能够进一步证明进阶学术实力，并且可以通过夏校争取教授推荐信。另外上过某个大学的夏校也可以证明对该校的入读兴趣，对一些大学来说，这种情况下再选择ED申请该校会有加成。
Before joining stoooges, Mimi has already applied several summer camps, and we have suggested her to add one more safety summer camp at Brown University.

Mimi is strong in writing, debating and acting. We highly recommend Mimi to join writing camps in winter times, and also, we highly recommend Mimi to join theatre summer programs next year, to aim for theatre major at Northwestern University.But, everything depends on Mimi's interest and her will on how to experience her summers.
·Reach&Target - NW National High School Treater - Jan. 1st https://nhsi.northwestern.edu/theatre-arts-application-information/
·Reach -writing camps of : lowa, Kenyon, Adroit, Kelly House, Yale
| Northwestern University National High School Institute

NHSI has been the premier university-based summer program for outstanding high school students since 1931. The oldest and largest university-based program of its kind, NHSI offers studies in Theatre Arts, Film & Video, and Debate as

follows:                                                           -Theatre Arts Institute Current high school juniors who will be rising into their senior year can choose this 5-week programs between Performance or Stage Management Design/Tech; Students also can choose the 2-week Musical Theatre Extension Program after the 5-week Theatre Arts program. Additionally students can choose 3 electives from a multitude of classes offered by the faculty in specialized areas of study from: Preparing for College Auditions, The Real Life of an Actor, Viewpoints, Self-Producing, Improvisation, Playwriting, Theatre for Social Change, Directing, Shakespeare Without Rears, Stage Combat; -Film and Video Institute For this 5-week program Students can select a concentration from: Acting on Camera, Screenwriting, Production. Applicants should currently be in the 10th grade/sophomore year or 11th grade/junior year. -Debate institute: Students must be rising into 9th, 10th,11th, or 12th grade the summer they are participating. Program takes hybird format (online+on campus course) with the choice of 4 weeks or 6 weeks.

The Boston University Summer Theatre Institute is a five-week pre-college experience which focuses on developing and crafting the skills of a multi-disciplinary theatre artist. Students graduate from BUSTI having honed their technique, depth of intellectual and artistic questioning, playfulness in collaboration, and ability to tell a dynamic story through the theatrical medium.

Pre-College Dramna is a six-week residential program for high school juniors and seniors that offers training and preparation for college auditions and interviews within an acclaimed drama conservatory. Students choose from one of three options below to prepare for an education and career in theater: -Acting: Acting, Audition, Acting for the Camera, Dramaturgy; training in Movement, Shakespeare, and Voice & Speech; -Design/Production: Basic Design, Technical Production, and Stage & Production Management; Introductory work in Lighting, Sounds, Video/Media, Costumes, and Fabrication Technology; -Music theatre: Audition process monologues and songs; Ballet and Jazz classes will provide inexperienced students; MT students will also take classes in Acting, Audition, Acting for the Camera, Song Coaching, and Dramaturgy. Optional workshops and master classes are held in the evenings; Weekends are intended for homework, independent rehearsal, and Student Affairs activities.
| Summer Workshop for Young Writers at Kelly W/riters House

Kelly Writers House will bring a small group of high school writers to Penn' s campus for ten days this summer to learn from the faculty from one another. The goal of this workshop is to provide creative hnigh school students, especially those who have not had similar opportunities, with the chance to dedicate full days to the practice of writing. Students will develop their own work and will read and critique their peers' writing in a setting similar to anundergraduate writing workshop. There will also be time to explore Penn and Philadelphia with fellow workshop students and program staff.
| lowa Young Writers' Studio: Summer Residential Program

Program accepts applications to the Summer Residential Program from students who are currently in the 10th, 11th or 12th grade. (9th graders may apply, though we only rarely accept them). The University of lowa Writers' Workshop was the first creative writing degree program in the United States, and since its founding in 1936, the program has been home to thousands of remarkable writers. The core courses are taught by graduates of the renowned lowa Writers' Workshop. Students may select a core course in fiction writing, poetry writing, TV writing, play writing or creative writing which includes some combination of fiction, poetry, and personal essay).

方向上提前进行大学水平的学习，其中含金量较高的夏校在大学申请时作用有时类似于学术类奖项，能够进一步证明进阶学术实力，并且可以
通过夏校争取教授推荐信。另外上过某个大学的夏校也可以证明对该校的入读兴趣，对一些大学来说，这种情况下再选择ED申请该校会有加
Before joining stoooges, Mimi has already applied several summer camps, and we have suggested her to add one more safety
Mimi is strong in writing, debating and acting. We highly recommend Mimi to join writing camps in winter times, and also, we
highly recommend Mimi to join theatre summer programs next year, to aim for theatre major at Northwestern University.But,
everything depends on Mimi's interest and her will on how to experience her summers.
·Reach&Target - NW National High School Treater - Jan. 1st https://nhsi.northwestern.edu/theatre-arts-application-
·Reach -writing camps of : lowa, Kenyon, Adroit, Kelly House, Yale
| Northwestern University National High School Institute
NHSI has been the premier university-based summer program for outstanding high school students since 1931. The oldest
and largest university-based program of its kind, NHSI offers studies in Theatre Arts, Film & Video, and Debate as
-Theatre Arts Institute Current high school juniors who
will be rising into their senior year can choose this 5-week programs between Performance or Stage Management
Design/Tech; Students also can choose the 2-week Musical Theatre Extension Program after the 5-week Theatre Arts
program. Additionally students can choose 3 electives from a multitude of classes offered by the faculty in specialized areas of
study from: Preparing for College Auditions, The Real Life of an Actor, Viewpoints, Self-Producing, Improvisation, Playwriting,
Theatre for Social Change, Directing, Shakespeare Without Rears, Stage Combat; -Film and Video Institute For this 5-
week program Students can select a concentration from: Acting on Camera, Screenwriting, Production. Applicants should
currently be in the 10th grade/sophomore year or 11th grade/junior year. -Debate institute: Students must be rising into
9th, 10th,11th, or 12th grade the summer they are participating. Program takes hybird format (online+on campus
course) with the choice of 4 weeks or 6 weeks.
The Boston University Summer Theatre Institute is a five-week pre-college experience which focuses on developing and
crafting the skills of a multi-disciplinary theatre artist. Students graduate from BUSTI having honed their technique, depth of
intellectual and artistic questioning, playfulness in collaboration, and ability to tell a dynamic story through the theatrical
Pre-College Dramna is a six-week residential program for high school juniors and seniors that offers training and preparation
for college auditions and interviews within an acclaimed drama conservatory. Students choose from one of three options
below to prepare for an education and career in theater: -Acting: Acting, Audition, Acting for the Camera, Dramaturgy;
training in Movement, Shakespeare, and Voice & Speech; -Design/Production: Basic Design, Technical Production, and Stage &
Production Management; Introductory work in Lighting, Sounds, Video/Media, Costumes, and Fabrication Technology; -Music
theatre: Audition process monologues and songs; Ballet and Jazz classes will provide inexperienced students; MT students will
also take classes in Acting, Audition, Acting for the Camera, Song Coaching, and Dramaturgy. Optional workshops and master
classes are held in the evenings; Weekends are intended for homework, independent rehearsal, and Student Affairs activities.
| Summer Workshop for Young Writers at Kelly W/riters House
Kelly Writers House will bring a small group of high school writers to Penn' s campus for ten days this summer to learn from
the faculty from one another. The goal of this workshop is to provide creative hnigh school students, especially those who have
not had similar opportunities, with the chance to dedicate full days to the practice of writing. Students will develop their own
work and will read and critique their peers' writing in a setting similar to anundergraduate writing workshop. There will also
be time to explore Penn and Philadelphia with fellow workshop students and program staff.
| lowa Young Writers' Studio: Summer Residential Program
Program accepts applications to the Summer Residential Program from students who are currently in the 10th, 11th or 12th
grade. (9th graders may apply, though we only rarely accept them). The University of lowa Writers' Workshop was the first
creative writing degree program in the United States, and since its founding in 1936, the program has been home to
thousands of remarkable writers. The core courses are taught by graduates of the renowned lowa Writers' Workshop. Students
may select a core course in fiction writing, poetry writing, TV writing, play writing or creative writing which includes some
combination of fiction, poetry, and personal essay).
